These rules apply to the SMS content.

<b> - Some typical patterns</b>:
  - Contains \"verification\": .*verification.*
  - Contains any of the words: .*(police|hospital|verification).*

A quick way to copy content from SMS messages or phone numbers, making it easy to grab verification codes or incoming numbers.

When it matches, a button like <b>Copy: 123456</b> will appear in the notification.

A sample rule for extracting verification codes:
  Using capturing group:
   code.*?(\\d+)
  Another approach using lookaround:
   (?<=code.{0,3})\\d+

Enable this rule for Call, SMS, or both.
Uncheck these checkboxes to disable the rule without deleting it.

When <b>Number</b> is checked, this rule will extract content from the incoming number. For example, use (.*) to copy the phone number.

When <b>Content</b> is checked, this rule will extract content from the SMS message body, such as verification codes.

When Passed is checked, this rule will apply to passed calls and messages.

When Blocked is checked, this rule will apply to blocked calls and messages.

This helps to check if the rules are set as expected.

It is just a simulation and will not actually popup an incoming call(or text message).

The result is shown here, and in history log, with notification.
